metadata.synopsis: The Dark Urge finds the Butler at their bedside after failing to kill Isobel. They are faced with the urge to kill, instead, whatever character has the highest approval to them (or their romantic partner, if they have one).Some characters are excluded from this murder.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Queue the Spared Isobel night from debug book;For testing with a specific character - add that character and raise their approval. If there are not party members, Gale will be added.

70.speaker: Narrator
70.text: *Your stomach churns around and around. The bile within is unsettled. Each moment brings a new surge.*
70.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Dark Urge is trying to sleep or rest, wakes up and starts pacing around a quiet part of the camp.

55.speaker: Narrator
55.text: *Your companions sleep like blissful lumps of meat.*
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: The BUTLER appears in this shot, beside the body of the Dark Urge's favourite companion.

36.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
36.text: He is an insult to the name of devils, posing as a monster with that sickly good heart.
36.context: CinematicNodeContext: Butler is crouched low beside the sleeping companion.

65.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
65.text: You could do so much better, Master.
65.context: CinematicNodeContext: Butler is crouched low beside the sleeping companion.

210.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
210.text: Have you forgotten? Whenever this frail carcass perishes, you shall always be sent a fresh Sceleritas.

178.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
178.text: You must have killed me hundreds of times since you were a youngling. I hope there will be hundreds more...

98.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
98.text: I won't lay so much as a talon on her. I wouldn't rob you of that delight.
98.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] The Butler rises to his feet, and lightly hops over the sleeping companion and bows in a groveling nature.

32.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
32.text: What in the Hells do you want?

195.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
195.text: I am here to watch your moment of triumph, my loathly Master.
195.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] The Butler rises to his feet, and lightly hops over the sleeping companion and bows in a groveling nature.

44.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
44.text: Cease this insubordination. You serve me.

94.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
94.text: I am but an eager messenger, from the depths of your dirty thoughts.
94.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] The Butler rises to his feet, and lightly hops over the sleeping companion and bows in a groveling nature.

142.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
142.text: Your clever mind is penning tragedy as we speak. Your repressed Urge yearns to kill.

5.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
5.text: And kill you will. Tonight, the moment you close your eyes, your favourite person will be brutalised.

117.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
117.text: I love her. No, it cannot be.

22.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
22.text: We all kill what we love most, in time.

187.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
187.text: She is my closest friend. It could never happen.

190.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
190.text: It will be the most perfect, most brutal death in your long career. Even from before your little indisposition.

92.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
92.text: No, I'll kill anyone else instead. But not one of my companions.

41.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
41.text: No. I'll kill the cleric instead, if I need to kill someone.

234.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
234.text: It is too late. You ignored your Urge, and now it is insatiable.

203.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
203.text: I am planning to kidnap Isobel. Alive.

50.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
50.text: You know there is murder slumbering within you, and in controlling it, it has grown insatiable. Your Dark Urge will have death tonight, one way or another.

49.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
49.text: I didn't lay a finger on Isobel. I can control myself.

220.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
220.text: It is precisely because you didn't touch her, that you are insatiable. Your Dark Urge will have death, one way or another. Tonight.

202.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
202.text: You've judged my affections wrongly - I am much closer to Astarion!

103.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
103.text: Then it should be a trifling matter to kill this one!

233.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
233.text: She was starting to trust you. The only one she ever has. Pity it's coming to an end.

67.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
67.text: She must live - I haven't yet told her how I truly feel about her.

135.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
135.text: Why not whisper it while you twist a knife? Or have a love confession be the final words between you?

124.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
124.text: We are indomitable together. You underestimate us.

10.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
10.text: You are wrong to consider another your equal.

1.text: Have you been watching us while we are together?

95.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
95.text: It is my duty to ensure you are making the right decisions, Master.

155.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
155.text: There was much disappointment at your reluctance to kill the little Moonmaiden.

7.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
7.text: You could kill this one deliberately. I'm sure it will be considered a great show of good will. The tithe could still be yours.

201.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
201.text: I will save her, whatever it takes.

39.text: There's no chance in the Hells I'm going to kill my companion.

132.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
132.text: I do not doubt you will act with the decorum befitting one of your rank.

172.speaker: Narrator
172.text: *Your companion rests blissfully, without a fear in the world.*

0.speaker: Narrator
0.text: Reach forward to shake her shoulder and wake her.

21.speaker: Narrator
21.text: *As your hand approaches her body, it wavers. It longs to close around her throat.*
21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reaches out their hand, but hesitates.

45.speaker: Narrator
45.text: Surrender to the Urge. Do your worst.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: Hmm...? Oh, has the mood struck you, love? I suppose we could try, if you think the others won't stir...
99.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] The Companion awakens from their sleep.Choose an appropraite start sleeping position for character, sit up during line

97.speaker: Player
97.text: Hold on, you look like you've had a shock - is something the matter?
97.context: CinematicNodeContext: [Greg] DU has a woozy expression.Companion should be in the sitting up pose after waking

170.speaker: Narrator
170.text: Now isn't the time. I need to protect you.

68.speaker: Narrator
68.text: A wicked wretch came to me in the night, and told me something horrible.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: Well, could be worse... It could have done something horrible. What did it say?
93.context: CinematicNodeContext: [Greg] DU has a woozy expression.Companion should be in the sitting up pose after waking

162.text: You are in a lot of danger. We need to act fast.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: All right, I'm awake. Tell me everything.
71.context: CinematicNodeContext: [Greg] DU has a woozy expression.Companion should be in the sitting up pose after waking

105.speaker: Narrator
105.text: *As you tell your story, fatigue fills your body. Your head swims with the worst headache you've known.*
105.context: CinematicNodeContext: DU has a pained expression

34.speaker: Narrator
34.text: The beast that killed Alfira will call again - my possessed mind will kill you.

17.speaker: Narrator
17.text: Madness will take over my body against my will, and I will kill you.

196.speaker: Player
196.text: Hells, what I wouldn't give for a boring lover sometimes.
196.context: CinematicNodeContext: [Greg] .Companion should be in the sitting up pose after waking

80.speaker: Player
80.text: How long has this been going on? Do I even want to know the answer to that...?
80.context: CinematicNodeContext: [Greg]Companion should be in the sitting up pose after waking

139.speaker: Narrator
139.text: I've been cursed. When I fall asleep, I will try to murder you.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: I'd rather you'd trusted me sooner, given all we've been through already.
76.context: CinematicNodeContext: [Greg] .Companion should be in the sitting up pose after waking

231.speaker: Player
231.text: Suddenly Alfira's death makes a lot more sense... We're going to figure this out, understand? We have to.
231.context: CinematicNodeContext: [Greg] .Companion should be in the sitting up pose after waking

53.speaker: Player
53.text: Seems like some sort of curse - the last bloody thing we need. But we're going to help you through this, together.

75.speaker: Narrator
75.text: *Suddenly you become drowsy. Your vision blurs and floods with yellow bile, and you faint in a dizzy blur.*
75.context:
CinematicNodeContext: DU struggling to stay awake and then faints.

Fade to black

194.speaker: Narrator
194.text: *You are not yourself. All control is gone.*
194.context: CinematicNodeContext: The DU has fainted, and we now see them with their hands tied behind their back. The companion sits nearby watching them. The Dark Urge is thrashing about.

175.speaker: Player
175.text: You convinced me to spare Nightsong. You and I are both capable of resisting the darkness that compels us.

232.text: Resist and try to express understanding.

185.speaker: Player
185.text: This thing won't have you. It won't win.
185.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.

167.speaker: Narrator
167.text: I will scoop out those watchful eyes and toss them to the dogs.

184.speaker: Narrator
184.text: I wish nothing more than to cut you up and eat you raw!

108.speaker: Player
108.text: No - keep back. No biting. This is worse than I thought...
108.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that. companion avoid the player trying to bite themNodeContext: [Astarion: as if telling off a toddler]

215.speaker: Player
215.text: If you've energy to flirt, you've energy to fight this thing. Stay with me, I know you can.
215.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.

69.speaker: Narrator
69.text: *Your hands are raw and bloody as every inkling of your Urge yearns to tear your bindings.*

225.speaker: Player
225.text: Easy. You're in control. Bloodlust won't win tonight.
225.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.NodeContext: [Astarion: genuinely reassuring]

25.speaker: Narrator
25.text: Your blood will clot for me like liquid rubies.

137.speaker: Player
137.text: Quite an imagination. Try applying it to some peaceful thoughts. I know you can.
137.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.

200.speaker: Narrator
200.text: The bruises I will give you shall gorge themselves on your blood.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: Whatever's whispering these rabid thoughts to you - block it out. Focus on me.
86.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.

62.speaker: Narrator
62.text: *The night passes sick and sweating, but bloodlessly.*
62.context: CinematicNodeContext: The scene fades into the next morning

206.speaker: Narrator
206.text: *You once again inhabit your own mind.*

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Are you back to yourself...? Hells, Alfira didn't stand a chance...
72.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: I think some more explaining is in order. Exactly what just came over you?
38.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.

66.text: Confess everything: you have been fiercely fighting against your Dark Urge.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: I'll help protect you, I promise. Seems I'll need to, just to keep myself safe.
33.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.

128.text: I promise I will be the person you see in me.

81.text: You are allowed to hate me for this.

127.speaker: Player
127.text: Let's save the hate for those who deserve it. This isn't your fault.
127.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.

133.speaker: Player
133.text: We'll best this - just think positively. Or at least... don't think murderously.
133.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.

197.speaker: Player
197.text: Besides, there's plenty of foes out there for you to vent your impulses on.
197.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.

140.speaker: Player
140.text: I won't quite say that - far from it. But you and I have a bond. I can't let a little bloodlust ruin that.
140.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.

188.speaker: Player
188.text: I'm sure someone will write a romantic ballad about this one day - hopefully not a tragic one.
188.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.

229.text: I've killed so many people. You should end me here and now.

208.speaker: Player
208.text: Well, it's always an option if we're out of ideas... but let's at least try to save you before it comes to that, hmm?
208.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.

104.text: Tell the story, but lay heavy blame on the Butler.

106.speaker: Player
106.text: Gruesome-sounding wretch - not something I envy of you.
106.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.

77.text: Recount your Urges, holding your past life responsible.

147.speaker: Player
147.text: That person's a stranger to me. Don't torment yourself with the past.
147.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.

160.speaker: Player
160.text: Growling? Come on, at least use words. You're better than this - fight it.
160.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: You can thank me once the bloodlust subsides. Keep focused.
119.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.

223.speaker: Narrator
223.text: *The maiming twitches consume you. You cannot talk.*

42.text: Resist and try to express understanding.

85.speaker: Narrator
85.text: *Your jaw convulses, and you almost bite off your own tongue.*

48.speaker: Narrator
48.text: I'm going to kill the person I care most about: you. Unless you can stop me.

179.speaker: Player
179.text: I suppose I'm flattered - and alarmed.
179.context: CinematicNodeContext: [Greg] .Companion should be in the sitting up pose after waking

171.text: Oh... sorry. I just had a bad dream. Go back to sleep.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: All right, then... Maybe if it happens again, try pinching yourself.

134.speaker: Narrator
134.text: *You return to your bedroll, and sleep like the dead.*
134.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade to black, companion will be dead the next morning.

214.speaker: Player
214.text: What the...? Hells, don't wake me like that. I was almost reaching for a weapon.
214.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] The Companion awakens from their sleep.Choose an appropraite start sleeping position for character, sit up during line

46.speaker: Narrator
46.text: *As soon as you raise the dagger, all doubts disappear from your mind, replaced by pure pleasure.*
46.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Dark Urge kills the companion in question

199.speaker: Narrator
199.text: *This is far more thrilling than your nights together ever could be.*

182.speaker: Narrator
182.text: *In the heat of the night, these last gasps are those of disappointment.*
182.context:
CinematicNodeContext: TAV kills the companion

Screen goes RED - Dark Urge

24.speaker: Narrator
24.text: *With almost no struggle, she has gone out like a light.*
24.context: CinematicNodeContext: *Tav glances over the dead body of the companion.*

230.speaker: Narrator
230.text: *You grant one last caress to your dead companion.*
230.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade to black, fade to the morning

228.speaker: Narrator
228.text: Wake up the others - you may be a danger to all of them.

163.speaker: Narrator
163.text: *Thoughts flittering, you prepare to be hated.*
163.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade to black, fade to the morning

213.speaker: Narrator
213.text: Remain for a while in the company of the corpse.

15.speaker: Narrator
15.text: *The corpse feels carefree, peaceful, and loving to linger beside.*

180.speaker: Narrator
180.text: *You drink in the sight until the dawn.*
180.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade to black, fade to the morning

145.text: Spend a while admiring the pretty corpse of your dead darling.

120.speaker: Narrator
120.text: *There is a beautiful blush on her cheeks that was never there while she was alive.*

13.text: Leave and go back to sleep.

102.speaker: Narrator
102.text: *Surely it is preposterous anything else would happen tonight?*

209.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
209.text: Your inheritance of your estate depends on you maintaining a healthy stream of kills.

161.text: Perhaps I might be stronger without such sentimental attachments.

177.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
177.text: You've judged my affections wrongly - I am much closer to Gale!

43.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
43.text: I am much closer to Halsin!

78.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
78.text: You've judged my affections wrongly - I am much closer to Jaheira!

123.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
123.text: You've judged my affections wrongly - I am much closer to Minthara!

152.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
152.text: You've judged my affections wrongly - I am much closer to Shadowheart!

153.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
153.text: You've judged my affections wrongly - I am much closer to Wyll!

74.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
74.text: You've judged my affections wrongly - I am much closer to Karlach!

219.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
219.text: You've judged my affections wrongly - I am much closer to Lae'zel!

164.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
164.text: You misunderstand - I don't care about her at all.

58.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
58.text: So all those sweet words were said in the hope of lying with her? Hah! A fine performance, O my itching liege!

158.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
158.text: Master, I am a professional. I've seen the two of you together. Every one of your darkest desires craves her.

122.text: You misunderstand - I don't care about her at all.

56.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
56.text: One of your station has no equal to call a friend.

8.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
8.text: You can try to deceive me all you wish - you cannot deceive your own heart.

157.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
157.text: Harming me will not aid her in the slightest. Nothing will at this point.
157.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] The Butler rises to his feet, and lightly hops over the sleeping companion and bows in a groveling nature.

113.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
113.text: He has his own devil, just as you have me. Aren't you a foul pair?
113.context: CinematicNodeContext: Butler is crouched low beside the sleeping companion.

40.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
40.text: He is so afraid. So, so afraid. Of everyone, besides you, who he ought to fear most.
40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Butler is crouched low beside the sleeping companion.

148.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
148.text: She came all the way to this world, just to die here.
148.context: CinematicNodeContext: Butler is crouched low beside the sleeping companion.

60.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
60.text: The gods fight over her, but is she truly that special?
60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Butler is crouched low beside the sleeping companion.

222.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
222.text: She thinks she is finally away from the monsters. Poor fool.
222.context: CinematicNodeContext: Butler is crouched low beside the sleeping companion.

186.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
186.text: He thinks he might end the world. But you and I could do far worse.
186.context: CinematicNodeContext: Butler is crouched low beside the sleeping companion.

144.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
144.text: There comes a time where every precious young Master must triumph over scrutiny.

9.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
9.text: Had you excelled instead of resisted, you would have received a disgusting Prize already. But it's not too late yet.

114.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
114.text: Your perfect instincts force your knife-arm. You know that well from the bard.

4.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
4.text: You will do something divinely unspeakable on this eve.

111.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
111.text: Your betters are no fans of the company you've been keeping...

181.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
181.text: At last! I've found the prodigal! And in what a sorry state, without your Butler to guide you.

101.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
101.text: I wish I'd discovered you drinking yourself to death in a tavern with some bedfellows of negotiable virtue, and not this debacle.

237.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
237.text: But worry not, your loyal Butler Sceleritas Fel is here, ready to get you back to behaving like a fellow of your fine breeding ought.

125.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
125.text: What in the hells do you mean you're my Butler?

192.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
192.text: I also tend to your grounds, manage your estate, arrange murder victims for you to systematically brutalise, and serve dinner.

54.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
54.text: Oh, rather. Can't you tell how the Urge is thickening? You have been altogether too good to appease it.

183.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
183.text: I tried time again to find you, after you became indisposed. Your inheritance is waiting, and I am waiting to grant it to you, if you do one little thing.

19.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
19.text: Do you know who I am?

100.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
100.text: Ah yes - the memory problem. I'm afraid I'm not allowed to interfere but know you had the thirstiest knife-arm in the Coast, before you were stolen away from my side.

217.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
217.text: Now, on to the matter at hand.

173.text: I think I'll slit your throat.

63.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
63.text: Oh, Master! Still as thirsty as ever. But tonight you should concentrate your efforts on another.
